content.text:
[@SoapDog charming friend](@gaQw6z30GpfsW9k8V5ED4pHrg8zmrqku24zTSAINhRg=.ed25519) 

I'd imagine that private naming works for one scenario, but it doesn't help my friends understand what a feed is about. For example, I'm super appreciative that someone named the gigantic spammy feed "infamous worm which blows up pubs", because otherwise I continue clicking it and downloading spam and filling up my hard drive. Do you think that it would be best to *not* label these feeds? This isn't something I've thought about a lot so I could probably be easily persuaded, but I see some utility in flagging *why* we've blocked a feed.
